comments_since_last_sample.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*

College is a personal decision. Taking out loans is a decision. Decisions have consequences. What lessons and life skills is society providing when we focus on idiotic practices of relieving people for the consequences and life impacts of their decisions? What is next? Free houses for everyone and cancellation of mortgages because people should not have to fulfill their debts for the house decision they have made? Where does this idiocy end OR where does it lead? Government housing for everyone, free education for everyone, a nation of college graduates who choose paths that add no value, earning potential or they just decide that they don’t like the educational path and just stay in college because it’s free and there is not consequence. Think just how stupid that comprehensive debt forgiveness really is.
That would be great. I know if it happened we'd almost immediately spend a bunch of cash with local contractors to get work done on our home.

How about first cancelling the debt of people who are facing bankruptcy due to enormous health care costs - because they got sick and needed care?  Getting sick can happen to anybody; and the reason for sickness is quite often hereditary. You might argue that individuals with student loans should have thought about the debt they incurred when they got the loans (just like anybody else who borrows they should understand loans must be repaid). Also, it doesn't seem fair to students who worked several jobs to pay for their education or for parents who saved and made enormous sacrifices to pay for their children's education so the children would not have to be burdened by student loans.

What message are you sending to the poor. That a bunch of entitled  white kids want to get everything for free while they are living from hand to mouth.  Pass this and you can kiss Dem majorities good bye for your lifetime.

Put the Interest Rate to 0% but these kids need to learn something about engaging in irresponsible debt that they either have no intention of paying back or have no drive to get work because it's everybody else's fault.
This is fox news garbage, even if the headline seems appealing.  As if they support her or what she stands for.

Can someone explain this to me? Isn’t going to college voluntary? If you want to study performance art and expect a career out of that but just get saddled with debt… I mean….. hello? What are we talking about here. If you go to school to be an electrician you pay a lot upfront but then you can get a job and work pretty much anywhere and will realistically pay back that loan without it ruining your life. Serious question.
I'll give Biden permission and I'm a whole lot cooler than Manchin.
Everytime I think about this (debt cancellation) I cannot fathom the reason for delay.
This has been posted more times than Biden has caved to Manchin and Enema
